metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Psalm 130: The Depth of Sin and the Radiance of Grace

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems humanity from a state of 'primordial catastrophe' and self-destruction.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities
to redeem his entire creation from its impulse toward self-destruction

zender.identificatie: The Trinity (God's own inner nature of love)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out
the church that was breaking his heart
not a single one of us would think himself too bad to receive any mercy

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
the love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (Mediator)

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Human Resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as petty rule-breaking but as a catastrophic ontological state ('no health in us') that humans cannot fix.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and worship as a result of being saved.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Honesty, Fear of the Lord, and Worship
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (confession) is explicitly framed as a movement enabled by the prior reality of God's forgiveness.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave.
The love of God bears all things.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself.

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
God... whose nature it is to give
desperate [Paul]... trying first one tack and then another
discovery that he is a God of infinite mercy
total inability to present ourselves righteous
God who can redeem humanity from so grave a predicament

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by God's 'pouvoir-faire' (sovereign power to save).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (The Depths) to ~S2 (Acknowledgment of Sin) to S1 (Grace/Forgiveness).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's character (S1) which exists independently of human merit.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'vast primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation and defines the human condition as one of total inability.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Think of those people who have borne with you... That person has conveyed to you a measure of the love of God.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who pursues us even beyond the grave.
There is no human being who can come up with enough credits.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human parents/mentors are used as 'glimmers' or 'hints' of God, but they are explicitly subordinated to the 'full radiance' of God.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The Watchman (as a figure of hope)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats them theocentrically: Paul's agony is a reflection of God's agony over the lost.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief, gratitude, and 'joyous and liberating knowledge'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where God acts and man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly integrated; the human response (Program 2) flows directly from the divine action (Program 1).
spanning_punten: The tension between 'fear of the Lord' and 'forgiveness'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' that sustains the believer in the 'last ditch'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'impulse toward self-destruction' and 'estrangement'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented actantial structure. God is the Subject of all redemptive verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a sermon on Grace.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Death) is already sufficiently cosmic.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of moralism by grounding human identity in the 'Receiver' actant and God's identity in the 'Subject' actant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the moving parental metaphors, Greimassian analysis reveals these metaphors function to establish God's agency, not to demand human imitation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Trinity; semiotics shows how the Trinity functions as a 'self-giving Subject' in the hearer's life-story.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas helps identify that 'Fear of the Lord' is a modal competence (Savoir/Pouvoir) granted by the Sender, not a work produced by the Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'miserable offender' language to maximize the 'Opponent' actant, thereby magnifying the 'Subject' (God).
